Further, it appears that the luminous body itsell is not seen bytherays ol its own light, whether direct or reflected. For a small lamp burning in a high place can be seen clearly enough several miles off, lar be· yond the bounds of its illumination, by an eye in a dark place. But this would not be if an image ol it were produced only by rays of its own light.

But to submit my own view on this question,l think it is to be held as at least a probable conjecture that the image ola small lamp, seen beyond the limits of its illumination, is propagated by a peculiar impulse which is quite different from the impulse of light.
